Brief Hospital Course:
___ w/hx of large R MCA hemispheric hemorrhage (___) with 
resulting left sided paralysis, aphasia, and seizure disorder, 
___ receiving nutrition through PEG tube admitted with 
worsening abdominal distention and leaking G tube.

# G tube leaking: Patient presents after recent replacement of G 
tube on ___, now sent back from rehab ___ to leaking tube. 
Evaluated by ___ and found granulation tissue but no evidence of 
leakage. Her tube feeds were restarted without difficulty or 
evidence of leakage.

#Electrolytes Abnormality- Patient with persistent hypokalemia, 
hypomagnesemia, and hypophosphatemia likely due to refeeding 
syndrome and ___. She required aggressive repletion of her 
electrolytes and BID labs. Her next chem-7 should be drawn on 
___
 
# ___- Patient with recurrent ___ multiple times in 
past now w/ persistent extensive distention of large bowels on 
imaging with abdominal distention and mild tenderness. 
Significant air evacuated post flexiseal and improvement in 
distention. She was restarted on her tube feeds without 
difficulty. Abdomen was soft and nondistended on discharge. If 
significant abdominal distention recurs would recommend 
replacement of flexiseal/rectal tube for venting.

# Atrial Fibrillation- Patient with Atrial Fibrillation w/ CHADs 
of 1 (prior stroke was hemorrhagic, not embolic). Currently on 
nadolol as beta blocker for rate control. She was started on 
apixiban during her ___ and prior ___ hospitalization for 
anticoagulation. However there is a drug interaction with 
phenytoin, which reduces the level of apixiban, making her 
subtherapeutic and not adequately anti-coagulated. Given her low 
CHADs score, prior hemorrhagic stroke, and drug interaction her 
apixiban was stopped and she was started on a low dose Aspirin 
81mg daily. If she requires anticoagulation in the future she 
would need Coumadin (instead of the newer anticoagulants) 

# Seizure disorder- stable, she was continued on her home 
medications. 

# Cirrhosis: Patient with h/o cirrhosis with grade 1 varices in 
___. She was continued on her nadolol and rifaxamin. Her 
spironolactone and Lasix were held due to initial NPO/Tube feeds 
being held. Should restart spironolactone and Lasix if Chem-7 
panel is normal on ___

#thrombocytopenia/anemia: Stable from prior. likely ___ 
cirrhosis

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Ms ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you at ___ 
___. You came to the hospital because of abdominal 
distention and concern that your feeding tube was leaking. You 
had a rectal tube placed that improved your abdominal 
distention. Your feeding tube was evaluated and fortunately 
there was no problem. You were restarted on your feeds and were 
closely monitored.  

We stopped your apixiban because it interacted with one of your 
medications and started you on Aspirin. 

Weigh yourself every morning, call MD if weight goes up more 
than 3 lbs.
